definition: apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc

sentences.english: Mc Donald's sell hamburgers-that great American fast food.
sentences.chinese: 麦当劳卖的汉堡包是一顶呱呱的美国快餐。

sentences.english: She is second to none among all the graduates.
sentences.chinese: 在毕业生中她是顶呱呱的一个。

sentences.english: She eis second to none among all the graduates.
sentences.chinese: 在钵毕业生中她是顶呱呱的一个。

sentences.english: He was good at his job .
Her typing is on the ball.
sentences.chinese: 她打字水平真是顶呱呱。

sentences.english: The Turpan grapes, Hami melons and Ili apples are all the best.
sentences.chinese: 吐鲁番的葡萄，哈密的瓜，伊犁的苹果顶呱呱。

sentences.english: He had a splendid black horse with a richly embroidered saddle-cloth .
sentences.chinese: 他骑的是一匹顶呱呱的黑马，鞍鞯绣得很华丽。

sentences.english: If they give a thumbs up, I am more willing to buy.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们说顶呱呱，我会更想买。

sentences.english: After soaking and steaming, the stinky socks should smell super.
sentences.chinese: 浸过蒸过后，臭短袜气味顶呱呱。

sentences.english: I think she's one terrific singer.
sentences.chinese: 我认为她是一个顶呱呱的歌手。

definition: first-rate/excellent (loanword from Japanese 一番, ichiban)
see 沒說的|没说的[mei2 shuo1 de5]
variant of 頂呱呱|顶呱呱[ding3 gua1 gua1]
every voice gives praise (idiom); with an extensive public reputation
(dialect) not that great/not up to much/nothing special
to have a skill/to have a lot on the ball/to have an affair
loved by all/to have universal appeal
